feed.title: Spire Global Joins $151 Billion Pentagon Missile Defense Contract Pool
feed.summary: Spire Global, Inc. (NYSE: SPIR) has been awarded a position on the Pentagon's $151 billion SHIELD contract vehicle, allowing it to compete for future defense tasks. This news comes despite the company reporting disappointing third-quarter earnings, missing revenue and EPS estimates, and lowering its full-year guidance. An analyst maintained a Buy rating but reduced the price target for Spire Global shares.

feed.summary: Spire Global (NYSE: SPIR) is preparing to release its Q3 earnings, with analysts projecting a loss of 33 cents per share on $21.17 million in revenue. feed.title: Spire and Planet expand satellite fleets on Transporter 15 mission
feed.summary: Spire Global Inc. and Planet Labs PBC have expanded their satellite fleets following SpaceX's Transporter 15 rideshare flight. Planet deployed two new high-resolution Pelican satellites and 36 SuperDoves to enhance Earth observation, while Spire launched eleven satellites, including replenishment spacecraft and those for Space Services customers, focusing on weather, maritime, aviation, security, and greenhouse gas monitoring applications.

feed.title: Shawn Mechelke Joins Spire Global as General Manager of Weather & Climate
feed.summary: Spire Global (NYSE: SPIR) has appointed Shawn Mechelke as its new General Manager of Weather & Climate, effective November 17, 2025. Mechelke will be responsible for leading the go-to-market, sales strategy, product roadmap, and global delivery of Spire's weather and climate solutions. He brings over 30 years of experience in the aviation and weather sectors, previously holding leadership roles at AFV Partners, NAVBLUE, and Schneider Electric/Telvent DTN.

feed.title: PwC resigns; KPMG engaged for Spire Global’s FY 2025 audit
feed.summary: Spire Global (SPIR) has finalized its auditor transition, with PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP (PwC) resigning and KPMG LLP being engaged as the new independent auditor for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2025. PwC's resignation became effective after the company filed its Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q on November 3, 2025. While PwC's prior audit reports included concerns about Spire Global’s ability to continue as a going concern, there were no disagreements on accounting or auditing matters.

feed.title: Satellite Vessel Tracking Market | Global Market Analysis Report - 2035
feed.summary: The satellite vessel tracking market is projected to grow from USD 169.6 million in 2025 to USD 781.2 million by 2035, exhibiting a CAGR of 16.5%. This growth is driven by increasing reliance on satellite-based monitoring for maritime safety, compliance, and fleet management efficiency, with the 10-100kg satellite mass segment and LEO orbit class segment expected to dominate. Key factors include stringent regulatory requirements, technological advancements in tracking systems, and the need for operational efficiency in fleet management, while market barriers include high equipment costs and connectivity challenges in remote areas.

feed.title: Class Action Filed Against Spire Global, Inc. (SPIR) Seeking Recovery for Investors - Contact Levi & Korsinsky
feed.summary: Levi & Korsinsky, LLP has filed a class action securities lawsuit against Spire Global, Inc. (SPIR) on behalf of investors who suffered losses due to alleged securities fraud between March 6, 2024, and August 14, 2024. The lawsuit claims that Spire Global made false statements and/or concealed information regarding embedded leases and pre-space mission activities for certain Space Services contracts, leading to overstated revenue and misleading statements about the company's business. Investors have until October 21, 2024, to request to be appointed as lead plaintiff.

feed.title: From Ska to Space: One Eagle’s Unconventional Journey to a Dream Career
feed.summary: Charlie Krone's journey from a ska band musician to a customer success engineer at Spire Global showcases how diverse experiences and a master's degree from Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University can lead to a dream career in the commercial space industry. His story highlights the importance of following one's passion and the practical value of specialized education in launching a career, even if it's an unconventional path. Krone now contributes to harnessing space data for Earthly challenges, emphasizing the critical role of business understanding in the space sector.

feed.title: Spire Global Announces Closing of $30 Million Registered Direct Offering
feed.summary: Spire Global, Inc. announced the closing of a registered direct offering totaling $30 million from the sale of 2,142,858 shares of Class A common stock at $14.00 per share. The company also issued investors an option to acquire an additional 2,142,858 shares at $14.50 each, potentially generating another $31 million. Proceeds from the offering are intended for debt repayment, working capital, and general corporate purposes.

feed.title: Spire Global Announces Third Quarter 2022 Results
feed.summary: Spire Global announced record third-quarter 2022 results with revenue of $20.4M, a 114% year-over-year increase, and record Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) of $98.1M, up 117% year-over-year. The company also improved its sequential ARR net retention rate to 135% and reduced net cash used in operating activities by 53% year-over-year. Spire secured significant contracts, including a nearly $10 million NOAA contract for radio occultation data, and provided positive financial guidance for Q4 and the full year 2022.
